alert.note: Alert for Lander Foothills; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 22 at 8:53PM MDT until April 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TO 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow developing late Friday evening and early Saturday morning.. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches in the lower elevations and 5 to 10 inches in the mountains. North wind frequently gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains East, Wind River Basin and Lander Foothills. * WHEN...From midnight to 6 PM Saturday. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur between 2 AM and 8 AM Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions mainly Saturday morning, with roads slushy in spots. Roads are expected to become mainly wet Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Backcountry enthusiasts, including snowmobilers, can easily become disoriented and lost. Frostbite and hypothermia can set in quickly.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Lander Foothills; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East
